import { LinkButton } from "@astrojs/starlight/components";

## Though we don't have access to the window object as we would in browser, when working with node we have the global object.

In addition to the timing functions previously mentioned, under `global.` you will find objects for all of our core data types, as well as thing like the console object, the Event and EventEmitter classes, Error class, the JSON library, Math library, and more.

You certainly don't need to memorize everything that is available in the global object, but do get in the habit of checking the API docs when time allows to deepen your knowledge of what is there.

You can also get a listing of what is available under the global object by doing the following:

- Open a terminal or shell
- Type `node` and press enter to start the Node REPL (Read-Evaluate-Print-Loop)
- Type `global.` (including the period) and then press tab twice

![Node REPL Global Object](data:image/png;base64,
_To exit the node REPL, press ctrl-d._
